Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Patent Medicine Trade Cards
Description.note: The trade cards are small, colorfully illustrated advertising cards touting a particular medicine and its many cures. The illustrations often have little to do with any of the ailments purported to be cured. They were pure advertising and very collectible.
Description.abstract: A collection of 247 patent medicine trade cards. Patent medicines were medical compounds sold under a variety of names and labels, though they were for the most part actually trademarked medicines, not patented. The trade cards are small, colorfully illustrated advertising cards touting a particular medicine and its many cures. The era of patent medicine began to unravel in the U.S. with the passage of the first Pure Food and Drug Act in 1906.

Title: Use Loring's Bitters [inscribed]
Description.caption: Use Loring's Bitters the best blood purifier in the market. Cures long-standing diseases...Treats strictly with roots and herbs.|~|Additional card text: Prepared by Prof. E. Loring, Stevens Place, Melrose, Mass.
Description.note: One of two brown monkeys in a cage, possibly in a zoo, holds a hat which it has snatched from the head of a little girl who is running away from the cage behind a boy. A yellow and green parrot in the center of the picture holds up a sign with the advertising text behind and above the boy and girl. To the right and in the background is a green tree.|~|Original trade card forms part of: Collection no. 311, History & Special Collections for the Sciences, Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library, UCLA.

The container has little white balls inside, and she is holding one in her right hand.|~|Original trade card forms part of: Collection no. 311, History & Special Collections for the Sciences, Louise M. Title: Three Most Reliable Remedies [inscribed]
Description.caption: Three most reliable remedies, Athlophoros for Rheumatism and Neuralgia, Athlo-Ointment for Sprains, Lameness, Sore throat, etc., Athlo-Tablets for Constipated Rheumatics...affliction could only be relieved by a remedy which would deal with the obstructive acid which poisoned and inflamed his blood, he devoted himself to study and experiment, aided by the best scientific help, to find such a remedy, the result being the discovery of Athlophoros...By its expulsion of rheumatic and neuralgic acid from the system, its invigoration of the muscles and healthy lubrication of the joints, Athlophoros has triumphed in every instance. This wonderful specific for hitherto incurable diseases is compounded with the utmost care, and contains nothing whatever that can injure the most delicate organism...
Description.note: Front of card depicts a fashionable young lady in a rose-colored dress holding a long necklace. Back of card not shown.
